location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 35/29 'Persian Gulf: question of payment to Sultan for telegraph facilities at Muscat'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 168; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns telegraphic communications in Muscat.The file contains:Request of Sultan of Muscat for payment of rent from Cable and Wireless Limited for telegraph cables landing in his territory, 1938Installation of a wireless set at Muscat by Cable and Wireless, 1939Licences to Cable and Wireless Limited for the landing of their cables at Muscat, 1939-47Agreement between Cable and Wireless and the Sultan of Muscat, 1948.The file contains correspondence between: the Political Agency at Muscat; the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf; the India Office; the Foreign Office; the Commonwealth Relations Office; the Government of India; the General Post Office; HM Treasury; Cable and Wireless Limited; Sa‘īd bin Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd, Sultan of Muscat and Oman; the Imperial Communications Advisory Committee, and the Air Ministry.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
